cellularAutomata.error.exceptions
Class IntegerStateOutOfBoundsException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          java.lang.RuntimeException
              cellularAutomata.error.exceptions.IntegerStateOutOfBoundsException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class IntegerStateOutOfBoundsException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException

An exception for when an integer state is out of bounds (not between 0 and numStates-1).

Author:
David Bahr
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary

          Creates an exception for when an integer state is out of bounds (not between 0 and numStates-1).

          Get the number of integer states allowed (allowed states are 0 to numStates-1).

Constructor Detail

IntegerStateOutOfBoundsException

public IntegerStateOutOfBoundsException(java.lang.String message,
                                        int numStates,
                                        int outOfBoundsValue)
Creates an exception for when an integer state is out of bounds (not between 0 and numStates-1).

Parameters:
message - A message detailing the error.
numStates - The number of allowed states (allowed states are 0 to numStates-1 inclusive).
outOfBoundsValue - The incorrect value.
Method Detail

getNumStates

public int getNumStates()
Get the number of integer states allowed (allowed states are 0 to numStates-1).

Returns:
The number of allowed states.

getOutOfBoundsValue

public int getOutOfBoundsValue()
The value that caused the error.

Returns:
The value that was not between 0 (inclusive) and numStates-1 (inclusive).
